bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: iOS Framework build of zlib fails with error-on-warning -Wimplicit-function-declaration
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/3610>http://code.opencv.org/issues/3610</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Rick Mann on 2014-03-14 02:13 || Priority: Normal || Affected: 2.4.8 (latest release) || Category: ios || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: x86 / iOS </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>iOS Framework build of zlib fails with error-on-warning -Wimplicit-function-declaration</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>When building zlib with the 2.4.8 build_framework.py, the build fails in zlib due to -Werror,-Wimplicit-function-declaration. This is with Xcode 5.1 release </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Ivan Korolev on 2014-03-17 06:46</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hi Rick, thanks for the bug report! Unfortunately, now we have limited human resources. So if you could investigate this issue and get back with some additional information or send a fixing pull request on GitHub (http://www.code.opencv.org/projects/opencv/wiki/How_to_contribute), it would be much appreciated!
- Assignee set to Rick Mann - Status changed from New to Open - Category set to ios </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Not reproduced on master and 2.4 branches - seems to be fixed.
